p: The principle of transparency underpins the other principles of an HRBA. To be able to participate and hold governments and other stakeholders to account, young people must have the information necessary to review and evaluate policies and progress, as well as the capacity to do so. For example, young people suggest that when they are armed with facts and knowledge about climate change, they are more likely to consider it a priority issue and want to act.61 To this end, youth-led organizations have campaigned for climate change education to be included in all school curricula.62 In November 2019, following months of petitions by young Italians, Italy became the first country to pledge to make climate change teaching compulsory in all public schools.63 Similarly, in Cambodia, climate change education has recently become compulsory in higher secondary school curricula.64
